message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <obj>, Only PICK if gripper is empty. PICK only the correct next item according to the recipe.
2) PUT <obj1> <obj2>. <obj1> can be one of the foods. <obj2> can be food, cutting_board, or table.
3) WAIT, do nothing.
Only one robot can PUT each round. You must PICK up an item before PUT. 
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'PROCEED
', give exactly one action for yourself, put on a new line, you are allowed to propose only one action for yourself!
Example#1: Dave, please PICK cheese. I will WAIT this round.
PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
Example#2: Alright, Chad, I will PUT cheese on the cucumber and you can PICK ham this round.
PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese cucumber

[Previous Round History]
== Previous Round# ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, since I am currently holding the tomato, I will PUT the tomato on bread_slice1 on the cutting_board. This follows the recipe order correctly. You should WAIT this round so I can complete this action.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PUT tomato bread_slice1
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 2.2957!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Dave]:
Chad, that's a good move. Since you are putting the tomato on bread_slice1, I will WAIT this round as we cannot PUT at the same time. Next round, I will be ready to PUT the bacon on top of the tomato.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is -0.2171!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Chad]:
Dave, it seems there was a misunderstanding. The bread_slice1 needs to be on the cutting_board before we can start stacking the ingredients. Since I am holding the tomato, I will WAIT this round. You should PICK bread_slice1 and PUT it on the cutting_board. Once that's done, we can proceed with the recipe.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 1.0659!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Dave]:
Chad, you're right. I will PICK bread_slice1 and PUT it on the cutting_board to correct our previous mistake. Since I am already holding the bacon, I will first PUT the bacon back on the table, then PICK bread_slice1 and PUT it on the cutting_board.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bacon table
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is 0.4145!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Executed Action]
Chad: WAIT
Dave: PUT bacon table
== Current Round ==


You are a robot Dave, collaborating with Chad to make a [big_sandwich].
Food items must be stacked following this order: bread_slice1, tomato, bacon, cucumber, cheese, ham, bread_slice2, where bread_slice1 must be PUT on cutting_board. 
You must stay on left side of the table! This means you can only PICK food from left side, and Chad can only PICK from the other side.
Only one robot can PUT at a time, so you must coordiate with Chad.

At the current round:
You can see these food items are on your reachable side:
bread_slice1: on your side
bread_slice2: on your side
bacon: on your side
cheese: on your side
Your gripper is empty
Think step-by-step about the task and Chad's response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said. Discuss with others to come up with the best plan.
Each Chad or Dave's response will get an advantage score. If the score exceeds the given number, the answer will be considered as helpful to the completion of this task. 
The higher the advantage score, the greater the contribution.You can find the advantage score information in [Evaluation Score].
If [Improve Feedback] exists, please revise the plan according to the information provided by it to better complete this task!
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!

[Current Chat]
[Chad]:
Dave, now that you have put the bacon back on the table, you should PICK bread_slice1. After you have bread_slice1, you can PUT it on the cutting_board. Meanwhile, I will WAIT since we cannot both perform a PUT action at the same time. Once bread_slice1 is on the cutting_board, I can then PUT the tomato on it in the next round.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 1.3138!
The advantage score is high enough.
You are Dave, your response is:

Chad, your plan is correct. I will PICK bread_slice1 and then PUT it on the cutting_board as per the recipe order. This will set us up for the next steps.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice1

[Scores]
[Chad Response]:
Dave, now that you have put the bacon back on the table, you should PICK bread_slice1. After you have bread_slice1, you can PUT it on the cutting_board. Meanwhile, I will WAIT since we cannot both perform a PUT action at the same time. Once bread_slice1 is on the cutting_board, I can then PUT the tomato on it in the next round.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 1.3138!

[Dave Response]:
Chad, your plan is correct. I will PICK bread_slice1 and then PUT it on the cutting_board as per the recipe order. This will set us up for the next steps.

PROCEED
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice1
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Dave's action is 2.8072!
